{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "QA Engineer",
  "description": "Lendastack&nbsp;is a fast-growing cloud based all-in-one solution company for managing financial services. We are building a platform that empowers business by providing them with an all-in-one loan, deposits, investments, reporting, user management and workflow customization solution. We thrive on innovation, agility, and a shared value of always delivering quality work.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: QA Engineer&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Job&nbsp;Description


	The ideal role holder is an experienced and forward-thinking QA Engineer, who can ensure software application quality, reliability, and performance by designing and executing test plans.
	You will play a role in maintaining product standards by performing both manual and automated testing and ensuring seamless user experiences.
	Also, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality, secure, and scalable solutions that meet business and user needs.


Minimum of 3 years&rsquo; of xperience as a QA Engineer (in the finance industry), with strong ability to:


	Conduct thorough manual and automated testing to identify and report bugs or issues that could impact product quality.
	Develop and execute test cases, test plans, and test scenarios to ensure comprehensive test coverage.
	Collaborate with the development team to resolve identified bugs and ensure timely product delivery.
	Use bug tracking systems to document and manage defects throughout their lifecycle.
	Implement and maintain automation to improve testing efficiency and ensure regression coverage.
	Document test results and prepare detailed reports for stakeholders, tracking progress towards set deliverables.


Other Requirements


	Strong proficiency in manual and automated testing methodologies.
	Experience with automation frameworks and scripting languages (e.g., Python, Java, JavaScript).
	Knowledge of API testing, SQL queries, and database validation.
	Strong attention to detail and commitment to delivering high-quality work.
	Understanding of compliance and regulatory requirements within the financial sector.
	Strong problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to propose effective solutions.
	Ability to work independently as well as in a team-oriented environment.
	Ability to engage with cross-functional teams and contribute to the success of collective goals.
	Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly and effectively.


Note:&nbsp;Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.",

QA Engineer Job at Lendastack




        
    

        
        Lendastack is a fast-growing cloud based all-in-one solution company for managing financial services. We are building a platform that empowers business by providing them with an all-in-one loan, deposits, investments, reporting, user management and workflow customization solution. We thrive on innovation, agility, and a shared value of always delivering quality work.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: QA Engineer 

Job Location: Lagos

Job Description
     

            
    




	The ideal role holder is an experienced and forward-thinking QA Engineer, who can ensure software application quality, reliability, and performance by designing and executing test plans.
	You will play a role in maintaining product standards by performing both manual and automated testing and ensuring seamless user experiences.
	Also, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality, secure, and scalable solutions that meet business and user needs.


Minimum of 3 years’ of xperience as a QA Engineer (in the finance industry), with strong ability to:


	Conduct thorough manual and automated testing to identify and report bugs or issues that could impact product quality.
	Develop and execute test cases, test plans, and test scenarios to ensure comprehensive test coverage.
	Collaborate with the development team to resolve identified bugs and ensure timely product delivery.
	Use bug tracking systems to document and manage defects throughout their lifecycle.
	Implement and maintain automation to improve testing efficiency and ensure regression coverage.
	Document test results and prepare detailed reports for stakeholders, tracking progress towards set deliverables.


Other Requirements


	Strong proficiency in manual and automated testing methodologies.
	Experience with automation frameworks and scripting languages (e.g., Python, Java, JavaScript).
	Knowledge of API testing, SQL queries, and database validation.
	Strong attention to detail and commitment to delivering high-quality work.
	Understanding of compliance and regulatory requirements within the financial sector.
	Strong problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to propose effective solutions.
	Ability to work independently as well as in a team-oriented environment.
	Ability to engage with cross-functional teams and contribute to the success of collective goals.
	Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly and effectively.


Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "Arion Energy Services Limited is an engineering, projects and operations services provider to the oil and gas, power and maritime industries. We are an agile and innovative company providing reliable solutions through our Adapt, Innovate and Resolve (AIR) approach to service delivery. We believe in developing exceptional teams to Adapt our services and tools to meet clients&rsquo; needs, Innovate solutions around project requirements and Resolve challenges to deliver expectations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Specialist&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

What You will Do


	Develop social media content calendar across all channels, ensuring consistency and creativity.&nbsp;
	Craft clear, engaging content tailored to diverse social platforms and audiences.
	Support marketing activities including promotions, events, and exhibitions.
	Spearhead innovative social media campaigns that foster customer connection, maximize engagement, and promote brand advocacy.
	Stay up-to-date with digital trends to enhance our digital presence.
	Oversee SEO, CRM, and performance KPIs across all media types.
	Other duties as required.&nbsp;


Key Qualifications


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Marketing, Communications, Journalism, or a related field.
	5+ years of experience managing social media platforms&nbsp;
	Proficiency with social analytics tools (Hootsuite, Facebook Analytics) and multi-social posting platforms (HubSpot, Buffer).&nbsp;
	Strong content creation, SEO, analytics and digital marketing skills.&nbsp;
	Excellent communication skills.&nbsp;


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@arionenergyservices.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Social Media Specialist Job at Arion Energy Services Limited




        
    

        
        Arion Energy Services Limited is an engineering, projects and operations services provider to the oil and gas, power and maritime industries. We are an agile and innovative company providing reliable solutions through our Adapt, Innovate and Resolve (AIR) approach to service delivery. We believe in developing exceptional teams to Adapt our services and tools to meet clients’ needs, Innovate solutions around project requirements and Resolve challenges to deliver expectations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Specialist 

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

What You will Do
     

            
    




	Develop social media content calendar across all channels, ensuring consistency and creativity. 
	Craft clear, engaging content tailored to diverse social platforms and audiences.
	Support marketing activities including promotions, events, and exhibitions.
	Spearhead innovative social media campaigns that foster customer connection, maximize engagement, and promote brand advocacy.
	Stay up-to-date with digital trends to enhance our digital presence.
	Oversee SEO, CRM, and performance KPIs across all media types.
	Other duties as required. 


Key Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Communications, Journalism, or a related field.
	5+ years of experience managing social media platforms 
	Proficiency with social analytics tools (Hootsuite, Facebook Analytics) and multi-social posting platforms (HubSpot, Buffer). 
	Strong content creation, SEO, analytics and digital marketing skills. 
	Excellent communication skills. 


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@arionenergyservices.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Inventory / Optical Manager",
  "description": "Eye Foundation Hospital (Operated by Summit Healthcare Hospital Ltd) is the leading eye care hospital in Nigeria with a vision to eliminate avoidable blindness in Nigeria and Africa. For over three decades, we have been at the forefront of delivering excellent and quality eye care through a network of primary, secondary, and tertiary eye care centers across Nigeria. We are a one-stop-shop for eye care with a wide range of comprehensive services of international standards offered by well-trained professionals with state-of-the-art equipment and environment. Renowned for our unwavering dedication and commitment to quality, we take pride in our esteemed reputation as a trusted and reputable healthcare institution.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory / Optical Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Report To: Optical Services Country Manager

Job Description


	The Inventory / Optical Manager is responsible for the operation of the store, keeping the store profitable and well-organized to ensure a pleasing experience for our customers.
	In addition, the Optical Manager delivers excellence in stock keeping.


Responsibilities
Your duties shall include, but are not limited to, the following:


	Admin skills, stock keeping skills.
	Drive the delivery of quality care to patients.
	Generates sales report.
	You are required to visit other branches as the need arises.
	Entering the optical daily sales of all branches in QuickBooks.
	Prepare monthly sales reports with the line manager at the end of the month.
	Reconciliation of invoices from various optical labs with the order placed and receipts at the end of the month.
	Assisting the optometrist in attending to patients.
	Assisting patients in choosing frames and lens options.
	Stock reconciliation at the end of the month.
	Follow up on glasses ordered from the laboratory.
	Ordering and collection of contact lenses when needed.
	Preparation of HMO report at the end of the month for the accounting and audit department.
	General administrative work in the optical department.
	Receiving and assisting patients in accessing the appropriate optical services.
	Providing effective clerical services and also attending to phone calls.
	Any other duties as assigned by your supervisor and Management.


Requirements


	A Bachelor&#39;s Degree in any relevant field, especially in Business Administration, Bookkeeping, or any other related courses
	A minimum of 2 years of working experience in a relevant field.
	Prior record-keeping, Adminexperience is an added advantage.
	Must be computer savvy.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;careers@eyefoundationhospital.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Inventory / Optical Manager Job at the Eye Foundation Hospital




        
    

        
        Eye Foundation Hospital (Operated by Summit Healthcare Hospital Ltd) is the leading eye care hospital in Nigeria with a vision to eliminate avoidable blindness in Nigeria and Africa. For over three decades, we have been at the forefront of delivering excellent and quality eye care through a network of primary, secondary, and tertiary eye care centers across Nigeria. We are a one-stop-shop for eye care with a wide range of comprehensive services of international standards offered by well-trained professionals with state-of-the-art equipment and environment. Renowned for our unwavering dedication and commitment to quality, we take pride in our esteemed reputation as a trusted and reputable healthcare institution.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Inventory / Optical Manager

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Report To: Optical Services Country Manager

Job Description


	The Inventory / Optical Manager is responsible for the operation of the store, keeping the store profitable and well-organized to ensure a pleasing experience for our customers.
	In addition, the Optical Manager delivers excellence in stock keeping.


Responsibilities
Your duties shall include, but are not limited to, the following:


	Admin skills, stock keeping skills.
	Drive the delivery of quality care to patients.
	Generates sales report.
	You are required to visit other branches as the need arises.
	Entering the optical daily sales of all branches in QuickBooks.
	Prepare monthly sales reports with the line manager at the end of the month.
	Reconciliation of invoices from various optical labs with the order placed and receipts at the end of the month.
	Assisting the optometrist in attending to patients.
	Assisting patients in choosing frames and lens options.
	Stock reconciliation at the end of the month.
	Follow up on glasses ordered from the laboratory.
	Ordering and collection of contact lenses when needed.
	Preparation of HMO report at the end of the month for the accounting and audit department.
	General administrative work in the optical department.
	Receiving and assisting patients in accessing the appropriate optical services.
	Providing effective clerical services and also attending to phone calls.
	Any other duties as assigned by your supervisor and Management.


Requirements


	A Bachelor's Degree in any relevant field, especially in Business Administration, Bookkeeping, or any other related courses
	A minimum of 2 years of working experience in a relevant field.
	Prior record-keeping, Adminexperience is an added advantage.
	Must be computer savvy.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@eyefoundationhospital.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Head of Operations Job at UHR Consult Limited




        
    

        
        UHR Consult Limited - Our client, a Finance company, is recruiting qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Operations

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements
     

            
    




	Do have a Bsc in Finance or a related field?
	Do you have a strong network of Investors, Financiers and industry players?
	Do you have advance knowledge of financial modeling, valuations, investment memos and deal structuring?
	Can you manage people?
	Do engage with stakeholders?
	Do you have up to 5years of experience in finance?
	If you do, this opportunity is for you
	Female Candidates only.


Salary
N1,000,000 - N2,000,000 Monthly. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: uhrconsultlimited2019@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only female candidates can apply.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Human Resource Manager",
  "description": "Universal Human Resource Consult is a human resource consulting firm that effectively manages private and government organization by ensuring adequate staff recruitment and selection, staff training and co-ordination thereby creating sustainable growth and increase quality of service delivery in organizations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Our client a logistics company is seeking a highly organized, strategic, and people-oriented Human Resources Manager to oversee the company&rsquo;s HR operations.
	The HR Manager will be responsible for developing and implementing HR strategies, managing recruitment, ensuring compliance with labor laws, fostering employee engagement, and supporting the company in achieving its business objectives through effective people management.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement HR policies, procedures, and initiatives aligned with the organization&rsquo;s goals.
	Oversee the recruitment, selection, and onboarding process to attract and retain top talent.
	Manage employee relations, including conflict resolution, grievance handling, and disciplinary procedures.
	Design and implement performance management systems to drive productivity and professional growth.
	Coordinate training and development programs to enhance employee skills and competencies.
	Ensure compliance with labor laws, regulations, and internal policies.
	Administer compensation, payroll, and benefits programs.
	Monitor HR metrics (turnover, retention, employee satisfaction) and prepare reports for management.
	Lead initiatives to promote a positive organizational culture, diversity, and inclusion.
	Provide HR guidance and support to management and employees at all levels.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Human Resource Management, Business Administration, or related field (Master&rsquo;s degree is an advantage).
	Minimum of 5 &ndash; 7 years of HR experience, with at least 2 years in a managerial or supervisory role.
	Professional HR certification (e.g., CIPM, SHRM, CIPD, HRCI) is preferred.
	Strong knowledge of HR practices, labor laws, and employment regulations.
	Proven ability to develop HR strategies and policies.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	High level of integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality.
	Proficiency in HR software and Microsoft Office Suite.


Salary
N500,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter in PDF format to:&nbsp;uhrconsultlimited2019@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-09-26",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

  },

Human Resource Manager Job at Universal Human Resource Consult




        
    

        
        Universal Human Resource Consult is a human resource consulting firm that effectively manages private and government organization by ensuring adequate staff recruitment and selection, staff training and co-ordination thereby creating sustainable growth and increase quality of service delivery in organizations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Manager

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	Our client a logistics company is seeking a highly organized, strategic, and people-oriented Human Resources Manager to oversee the company’s HR operations.
	The HR Manager will be responsible for developing and implementing HR strategies, managing recruitment, ensuring compliance with labor laws, fostering employee engagement, and supporting the company in achieving its business objectives through effective people management.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement HR policies, procedures, and initiatives aligned with the organization’s goals.
	Oversee the recruitment, selection, and onboarding process to attract and retain top talent.
	Manage employee relations, including conflict resolution, grievance handling, and disciplinary procedures.
	Design and implement performance management systems to drive productivity and professional growth.
	Coordinate training and development programs to enhance employee skills and competencies.
	Ensure compliance with labor laws, regulations, and internal policies.
	Administer compensation, payroll, and benefits programs.
	Monitor HR metrics (turnover, retention, employee satisfaction) and prepare reports for management.
	Lead initiatives to promote a positive organizational culture, diversity, and inclusion.
	Provide HR guidance and support to management and employees at all levels.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resource Management, Business Administration, or related field (Master’s degree is an advantage).
	Minimum of 5 – 7 years of HR experience, with at least 2 years in a managerial or supervisory role.
	Professional HR certification (e.g., CIPM, SHRM, CIPD, HRCI) is preferred.
	Strong knowledge of HR practices, labor laws, and employment regulations.
	Proven ability to develop HR strategies and policies.
	Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	High level of integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality.
	Proficiency in HR software and Microsoft Office Suite.


Salary
N500,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter in PDF format to: uhrconsultlimited2019@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply
